                                      Description=NTP client/server

                                      Documentation=man:chronyd(8) man:chrony.conf(5)

                                      After=ntpdate.service sntp.service ntpd.service

                                      ConditionCapability=CAP_SYS_TIME

                                      Type=forking

                                      PIDFile=/var/run/chronyd.pid

                                      EnvironmentFile=-/etc/sysconfig/chronyd

                                      ExecStart=/usr/sbin/chronyd $OPTIONS

                                      ExecStartPost=/usr/libexec/chrony-helper update-daemon

                                      PrivateTmp=yes

                                      ProtectHome=yes

                                      ProtectSystem=full

                                      [root@localhost etc]# cat /etc/inittab 
# inittab is no longer used when using systemd.
#
# ADDING CONFIGURATION HERE WILL HAVE NO EFFECT ON YOUR SYSTEM.
#
# Ctrl-Alt-Delete is handled by /usr/lib/systemd/system/ctrl-alt-del.target
#
# systemd uses 'targets' instead of runlevels. By default, there are two main targets:
#
# multi-user.target: analogous to runlevel 3    #ç±»ä¼¼è¿è¡Œçº§åˆ«3
# graphical.target: analogous to runlevel 5     #ç±»ä¼¼è¿è¡Œçº§åˆ«5
#
# To view current default target, run:
# systemctl get-default                    #æŸ¥çœ‹ç³»ç»Ÿè¿è¡Œçº§åˆ«
#
# To set a default target, run:
# systemctl set-default TARGET.target      #ä¿®æ”¹ç³»ç»Ÿé»˜è®¤è¿è¡Œçº§åˆ«
